////—1—//// 25:7:1,**Onyx stones.** There were two required for the needs of the <font color=d50505>»</font>eiphod<font color=d50505>«</font> which is discussed in the <font color=d50505>»</font>parsha<font color=d50505>«</font> <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>וְאַתָּה <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>תְּצַוֶּה .

§§—2—§§ 25:7:1, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אבני <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שהם ONYX STONES — two were required there for the needs of the “ephod” which is mentioned in <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ואתה <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>תצוה (Exodus 28:6ff.).

—3— **7. Schohamsteine,** zwei waren dort nötig, für das Efod, das in 28,6) <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אתה <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>תצרה) vorkommt. 

---

////—1—//// 25:7:2,"**Filling.** Because they made for them (i.e., the stones) a setting like a notch, in the gold into which the stone is put to <font color=d50505>»</font>fill<font color=d50505>«</font> the notch, they are called <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אַבְנֵי <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מִלּוּאִים — “filling stones.” The place of the setting is called <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מִשְׁבֶּצֶת . "

§§—2—§§ 25:7:2," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מלאים FOR SETTING (lit., filling in) — Because they made for them (for the stones) settings in gold — a kind of indentation — and they put the stone there (in it) to fill the indentation, they were called “filling-up stones”; the spot where the indentation is (i. e. the hollow spot) is called <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>משבצת “setting”."

—3— **Der Füllungen;** weil man für sie aus Gold eine Fassung, wie eine Vertiefung, machte, in die man den Stein hineinlegte, um die Vertiefung auszufüllen, darum werden sie Steine der Füllungen genannt; die Fassung selbst wird <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>משבצת genannt. 

---

////—1—//// 25:7:3,**[Into] the eiphod and the breastplate —** the onyx stones for the <font color=d50505>»</font>eiphod<font color=d50505>«</font> and the filling-stones for the breastplate. The <font color=d50505>»</font>choshen<font color=d50505>«</font> and <font color=d50505>»</font>eiphod<font color=d50505>«</font> are described in the <font color=d50505>»</font>parsha<font color=d50505>«</font> <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>וְאַתָּה <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>תְּצַוֶּה . They are kinds of ornaments [for the <font color=d50505>»</font>kohein godol<font color=d50505>«</font>].

§§—2—§§ 25:7:3, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לאפד <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ולחשן FOR THE EPHOD AND THE BREASTPLATE respectively: the onyx stones for the ephod and “stones for setting” for the breastplate. Ephod and breastplate are described in <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ואתה <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>תצוה. They were a kind of ornament worn only by the High-Priest.

—3— **Für das Efod und das Brustschild,** die Schohamsteine für das Efod und die Steine der Füllungen für das Brustschild; Choschen und Efod werden in <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אתה <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>תצרה erklärt; sie waren Arten von Schmuck.

////—1—//// 25:8:1,**They shall make a Sanctuary for Me.** They shall make for the sake of My Name a house of holiness.

§§—2—§§ 25:8:1, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ועשו <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לי <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מקדש AND LET THEM MAKE ME A SANCTUARY — Let them make to the glory of My Name (cf. Rashi on v. 2) a place of holiness.

—3— **8. Und sie sollen mir ein Heiligtum bauen,** sie sollen meinem Namen zu Ehren ein Haus der Heiligkeit errichten.

////—1—//// 25:9:1,"**According to all that I am showing you —** here, the form of the <font color=d50505>»</font>mishkon.<font color=d50505>«</font> This verse is connected to the verse that precedes it: [i.e.] “They shall make a sanctuary for Me, according to all that I am showing you.” "

§§—2—§§ 25:9:1," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ככל <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אשר <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אני <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מראה <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אותך ACCORDING TO ALL THAT I AM SHOWING THEE here, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>את <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>תבנית <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>המשכן THE PATTERN OF THE DWELLING. — This verse must be connected with the verse that precedes it, thus: And let them make for Me a sanctuary … according to all that I am showing thee (the words <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ושכנתי <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בתוכם being a parenthesis)."

—3— **9. Ganz wie ich dir zeige,** hier,  **die Gestalt der Wohnung,** dieser Vers ist mit dem Vers vorher verbunden; sie sollen mir ein Heiligtum bauen, ganz, wie ich dir zeige.

////—1—//// 25:9:2,"**And so should you make it —** in future generations, in the event that one of the vessels should be lost or when you will make for Me the vessels for the Eternal House (the <font color=d50505>»</font>Beis Hamikdosh<font color=d50505>«</font>), such as the tables, the lamps, the wash basins, and the stands [for the wash basins] which Shlomo made, then make them according to the forms of these. If this verse were not connected [to the verse] that precedes it then it would <font color=d50505>»</font>not<font color=d50505>«</font> have said <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>וְכֵן <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>תַּעֲשׂוּ but, rather, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>כֵּן <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>תַּעֲשׂוּ (without the <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ו') and it would have referred to the making of the Tent of Meeting (i.e., the <font color=d50505>»</font>Mishkon<font color=d50505>«</font>) and its vessels [and not to future generations]. "

§§—2—§§ 25:9:2," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>וכן <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>תעשו AND SO SHALL YE MAKE IT also in future generations (cf. Sanhedrin 16b); if one of the vessels is lost, or when you make for Me the vessels for the “House of Eternity” (another name for the Temple in Jerusalem), — as e. g., the tables, candlesticks, lavers and stands which Solomon had made — you shall make them after the pattern of these (the vessels of the Tabernacle), If, however, the verse were not to be connected with the preceding one but formed a new statement, Scripture ought not to have written: <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>וכן <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>תעשו “and so shall ye make them” but <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>כן <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>תעשו “so shall ye make them” and then it would be speaking of the making of the tent of meeting and its vessels and not of the vessels of the Temple, and the translation would be: according to all that I am showing you the pattern of the Tabernacle and the pattern of all its vessels, even so shall you make them."

—3— **Und so sollt ihr tun,** auch in den späteren Geschlechtern (Sanhedrin 16b), wenn eins von den Geräten verlorengehen sollte oder wenn ihr für mich die Geräte des Tempels machen werdet, wie die Tische, Leuchter, Waschbecken und Gestelle, die Schelomo verfertigte; gleich der Gestalt von diesen sollt ihr sie machen; wenn aber der Vers nicht mit dem vorhergehenden verbunden wäre, hätte er nicht schreiben dürfen <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>וכן sondern <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>כן, so sollt ihr tun; und dann würde er von der HerStellung des Zeltes der Offenbarung und seiner Geräte sprechen.

////—1—//// 25:10:1,**They shall make an ark —** similar to boxes which are made without legs — made like a chest called <font color=d50505>»</font>escrin<font color=d50505>«</font> [in Old French] which rests on its bottom.

§§—2—§§ 25:10:1, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ועשו <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ארון AND THEY SHALL MAKE AN ARK (<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ארון) — It is so called because it had the appearance of boxes (<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ארונות) which people make without feet — in the shape of a chest which is called escrin in old French which rests on its bottom.

—3— **10. Sie sollen eine Lade machen,** gleich den Laden, die man ohne Füße macht, die wie Truhen gemacht sind, die man in anderen Sprachen Schrein nennt und die auf ihrem Boden ruhen.

////—1—//// 25:11:1,"**You shall cover it inside and out.** Bezalel made three arks, two of gold and one of wood. Each one had four walls and a bottom and were open at the top. (<font color=d50505>»</font>see illustration 1 on page 140<font color=d50505>«</font>) He placed the wooden one intoA the [large] golden oneB and the [small] golden oneC into the wooden one. He then covered the upper rim with gold.D Consequently, it was covered [with gold] on the inside and on the outside. "

§§—2—§§ 25:11:1," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מבית <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ומחוץ <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>תצפנו WITHIN AND WITHOUT SHALT THOU OVERLAY IT — Bezalel made three arks, two of gold and one of wood, each having four walls (sides) and a bottom, being, however, open at the top. He put the wooden ark into the larger golden one and the smaller golden one into that of wood and covered its upper rim (that of the wooden ark) with gold; consequently it can be said that the wooden ark was overlaid with gold within and without (Yoma 72b; Jerusalem Talmud Shekalim 6:1)."

—3— **11. Von innen und von außen sollst du sie überziehen,** drei Laden machte Bezalel, zwei von Gold und eine von Holz; jede hatte vier Wände und einen Boden, und oben waren sie offen; er stellte die von Holz in die von Gold und die von Gold in die von Holz und überzog den Rand oben mit Gold, so dass sie von innen und von außen überzogen war (Joma 72b). 

---

////—1—//// 25:11:2,"**Golden crown-like rim.** There was a crown-like [ornament] circled around above the edge, for he made the outer ark taller than the inner one so that it rose up against the thickness of the cover and somewhat above it. [Consequently] when the cover was lying on the thickness of the walls [of the inner arks] the [crown-like] rim rose above the entire thickness of the cover a slight amount. This was to symbolize the crown of the Torah. "

§§—2—§§ 25:11:2," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>זר <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>זהב A BORDER OF GOLD — a crown-like ornament encompassed it (the ark) round about above its rim, for he (Bezalel) made the outer ark which was of gold higher than the inner ones so that it stood up over against the thickness of the cover which was made for it and even somewhat beyond it (Yoma 72b). Now when the cover lay upon the thickness of the sides of the two smaller arks the crown-like ledge rose a little above the entire thickness of the cover. It was a symbol of the “crown of the Torah” which was placed within that ark (Exodus Rabbah 34b)."

—3— **Eine goldene Krone,** eine Art Diadem umgab sie ringsum über dem Rande; er machte die äussere Lade höher als die innere, dass sie der Dicke des Deckels gegenüber und noch etwas darüber emporragte; und wenn der Deckel auf der Dicke der Wände ruhte, überragte die Krone um etwas die ganze Dicke des Deckels; sie war ein Symbol für die Krone der Torah.

////—1—//// 25:12:1,**Cast.** <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>וְיָצַקְתָּ is a term for casting metal as Onkelos translates it [<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>וְתַתִּיךְ from <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>הַתָּכָה].

§§—2—§§ 25:12:1," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ויצקת — a term used of casting metal, as the Targum has it."

—3— **12. gieße für sie,** bedeutet gießen, wie der Targum sagt. 

---

////—1—//// 25:12:2,"**Its corners.** As Onkelos translates it: <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>זִוְיָתֵיה (its corners). It was at the upper corners, near the cover, that they (the rings) were placedE — two on one side and two on the other, along the width of the ark. The poles were put through them (the rings) and the length of the ark separated the poles — two and a half cubits between the poles so that the two persons carrying the ark were able to walk between them (the poles).F So it is explained in Menachos, Chapt. <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שְׁתֵּי <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>הַלֶּחֶם . "

§§—2—§§ 25:12:2," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>פעמתיו — Understand this as the Targum renders it: ON ITS CORNERS. It was on the upper corners near to the cover that the rings were placed — two on one side of the ark and two on the other along the breadth of the ark, and the staves were put into them (the rings). The length of the ark thus formed a space of two cubits and a half between one stave and the other so that two men who were carrying the ark could walk with ease between on the same side. Thus is it explained in Treatise Menachot in the section beginning with the words, ""Shtei HaLehem"" (Menachot 98b)."

—3— **Ecken,** wie der Targum sagt, Winkel; an den oberen Ecken, nahe am Deckel, brachte man zwei Ringe auf dieser Seite und zwei auf dieser Seite an der Breitseite der Lade an, in sie wurden die Stangen gelegt; und die Längsseite der Lade trennte die Stangen 2 1/2 Ellen befanden sich zwischen einer Stange und der anderen, damit zwei Menschen, welche die Lade trugen, dazwischen gehen konnten; so wird in Menachot im Abschnitt 98) <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שתי <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>הלחםb) erklärt. 

---

////—1—//// 25:12:3,"**Two rings on one side.** These are the very same four rings that are [mentioned] at the beginning of the verse, and now it explains to you where they were [placed]. This [prefix-letter] <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ו' [of <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>וּשְׁתֵּי] is superfluous and should be interpreted as if it had said: <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שְׁתֵּי <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>טַבָּעוֹת (without the <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ו'). However, you can fit it (the <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ו') as follows: “<font color=d50505>»</font>And<font color=d50505>«</font> two of these [above-mentioned] rings [you shall put] on one side.” "

§§—2—§§ 25:12:3," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שתי <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>הלחם <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ושתי <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>טבעות <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>על <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>צלעו <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>האחת AND TWO RINGS IN THE ONE SIDE OF IT — These are the very four rings spoken of in the beginning of the verse but here Scripture explains to you where they were fixed. This <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ו of the word <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ושתי (the first time the word occurs here) is really redundant and the interpretation is as though it read, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שתי <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>טבעת (see Note on Exodus 24:12). Since however the <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ו is there you may make it fit in thus: and two of these rings shall be on the one side of it and two on the other side thereof."

—3— **Zwei Ringe auf der einen Seite**… das sind die vier Ringe vom Anfang des Verses, und er erklärt dir jetzt, wo sie sich befanden; das Waw von <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ושתי ist übrig; denn die Bedeutung der Worte ist dieselbe, wie wenn <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שתי stehen würde; und man muss es so erklären, und zwei von diesen Ringen seien auf der einen Seite, Seite = 13. <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>צדו.

§§—2—§§ 25:12:4, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>צלעו means THE SIDE OF IT.

—3— **Stangen,** Tragstangen.

—3— **15. Sie sollen nicht davon weichen,** niemals (Joma 72a).

§§—2—§§ 25:16:1," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ונתת <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אל <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>הארן — It must be explained as though it were written <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בארון: [AND THOU SHALT PUT] INTO THE ARK,"

—3— **16. Und lege in die Lade** = <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בארון.

////—1—//// 25:16:2,"**The Testimony.** The Torah, which is testimony between Me and you that I have commanded to you the commandments written in it. "

§§—2—§§ 25:16:2,"<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>העדות THE TESTIMONY — the Torah (the Tablets; cf. 
§§—2—§§ 40:20) which is a testimony between Me and you that I have ordained the commandments written in it (Midrash Tanchuma, Pekudei 4)."

—3— **Das Gesetz,** die Torah, die zum Zeugnis ist zwischen mir und euch, dass ich euch die in ihr aufgeschriebenen Gebote befohlen habe.

////—1—//// 25:17:1,**A cover.** [The <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>כַּפֹּרֶת is] the cover on the ark which was [constructed] open at the top. He placed it [the cover] on top like a flat board.

§§—2—§§ 25:17:1," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>כפרת — A cover for the ark which was made open on top. He laid it upon it, flat like an ordinary slab."

—3— **17. Einen Deckel,** einen Deckel für die Lade, die oben offen war, und er legte ihn wie eine Platte darauf.

////—1—//// 25:17:2,"**Two and one-half amohs long.** I.e., the same length as the ark. And its width was the same as the width of the ark. It lay on the thickness of the [ark’s] four walls. Though it gives no size for its (the cover’s) thickness, our Sages explained that its thickness was a <font color=d50505>»</font>tefach.<font color=d50505>«</font> "

§§—2—§§ 25:17:2," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אמתים <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>וחצי <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ארכה TWO CUBITS AND A HALF SHALL BE THE LENGTH THEREOF, as was the length of the ark, and its (the cover’s) breadth was as the breadth of the ark (i. e. of the inner wooden ark, cf. Rashi on v. 11); thus it rested on the thickness of its four walls. Although it does not assign any size for its (the cover’s) thickness our Rabbis have explained (applying to it a <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ג""<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ש) that the thickness thereof was one cubit (Sukkah 5a)."

—3— **2 1/2 Ellen seine Länge,** gleich der Länge der Lade, und seine Breite gleich der Breite der Lade, er lag auf der Dicke der vier Wände; und obschon er kein Maß für die Dicke angegeben hat, so haben unsere Lehrer erklärt, dass seine Dicke eine Handbreite betrug (Suc. 5a).

////—1—//// 25:18:1,**Cherubim.** They had the likeness of a child’s face.

§§—2—§§ 25:18:1, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>כרבים CHERUBIM — They had the form of a child’s face (Sukkah 5a).

—3— **18. Cherubim,** sie hatten die Form des Angesichtes eines Kindes (Succa 5b).

////—1—//// 25:18:2,"**Make them by hammering.** Do not make them separately and then attach them to the ends of the cover after having made them, as is done by smiths [through a process] that is called <font color=d50505>»</font>soldez<font color=d50505>«</font> in Old French (solder). But, rather, place a large amount of gold at the start of the constructing of the cover. Then hit with a hammer and a mallet at the middle [of this mass of gold] so that the ends will protrude upwards and form the cherubim out of the protrusions of its ends. "

§§—2—§§ 25:18:2," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מקשה <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>תעשה OF BEATEN WORK SHALT THOU MAKE [THEM] — i. e. thou shalt not make them separately (apart from the actual lid) and join them to the ends of the lid after they have been made, like goldsmith’s work which is called in old French souder (English solder) — but lay down a large mass of gold (lit., much gold) when thou beginnest to make the lid and beat upon the middle part of it (the gold) with a hammer or with a mallet, so that its ends will project upward (stand out in relief), and then shape the cherubim out of the projecting edges."

—3— **Getriebene Arbeit sollst du sie machen,** mache sie nicht für sich, um sie erst nach ihrer Verfertigung an den Enden des Deckels zu befestigen, wie die Goldschmiede tun, löten in anderen Sprachen; sondern lege schon beim Beginn der Verfertigung des Deckels ein großes Stück Gold hin und schlage mit großem und kleinem Hammer in die Mitte, dass die Ende emporragen, und forme die Cherubim aus den emporragenden Enden. 

---

////—1—//// 25:18:3,"**Hammered.** <font color=d50505>»</font>Batediz<font color=d50505>«</font> in Old French (hammered), as in “they banged (<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>נָקְשָׁן) against each other.” "

§§—2—§§ 25:18:3, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מקשה batediz (beaten work) in old French Similarly we have (Daniel 5:6) “and his knees knocked (<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>נקשן) one against another”.

—3— **Getrieben,** geschlagen in anderen Sprachen, wie (Dan. 5,6), und seine Knie schlugen aneinander. 

---

////—1—//// 25:18:4,**The ends of the cover.** [Meaning:] the extreme ends of the cover.

§§—2—§§ 25:18:4, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>קצות <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>הכפרת means THE EXTREMITIES OF THE COVER.

—3— **Enden des Deckels,** Spitzen des Deckels. 

---

////—1—//// 25:19:1,**Make one cherub out of one end.** So that you should not [mistakenly] say that there were two cherubim at each end. It was therefore necessary to explain “One cherub out of one end.”

§§—2—§§ 25:19:1," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ועשה <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>כרוב <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אחד <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מקצה AND MAKE ONE CHERUB FROM ONE EXTREMITY — In order that you should not say that the preceding verse means two cherubim on each extremity, it was necessary to expressly state: “one cherub from the one extremity and one cherub from the other extremity”."

—3— **19. Und mache einen Cherub aus dem Ende;** dass du nicht sagest, zwei Cherubim an jedem Ende, darum muss er erklären, **einen** Cherub aus dem Ende von dieser Seite … aus dem Deckel selbst machet die Cherubim, das ist die Erklärung von, aus getriebener Arbeit sollst du sie machen, mache sie nicht für sich, um sie dann mit dem Deckel zu verbinden. 

---

////—1—//// 25:19:2,"**From the cover —** itself shall you make the cherubim. This is the explanation of: “You must make them by hammering them,” that you not make them separately and then attach them to the cover. "

§§—2—§§ 25:19:2," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מן <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>הכפרת FROM THE COVER itself, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>תעשו <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>את <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>הכרבים SHALL YE MAKE THE CHERUBIM — This is the explanation of: (v. 18) “of beaten work shalt thou make them” — that thou shalt make them out of the cover itself and that thou shalt not make them by themselves and afterwards join them to the cover."


---

////—1—//// 25:20:1,"**Shall spread their wings.** Do not make their wings lying [against their bodies] but, rather, spread open and reaching up above near their heads, so that there be ten <font color=d50505>»</font>tefachim<font color=d50505>«</font> in the space that is between the wings and the cover, as is cited in Succah (5b). "

§§—2—§§ 25:20:1," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>פרשי <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>כנפים [AND THE CHERUBIM SHALL] SPREAD THEIR WINGS [ON HIGH] — i. e. that you shall not make their wings touching the body but spreading on high slightly above but almost on the same level with their heads so that the hollow space between the wings and the cover shall be ten handbreadths, as it is explained in Treatise Sukkah 5b."

—3— **20. Die Fittiche ausbreiten,** mache ihre Flügel nicht liegend, sondern ausgebreitet und neben ihren Häuptern zu Höhe erhoben, so dass der Raum zwischen den Fittichen und dem Deckel zehn Handbreiten beträgt, wie in Succa (5b) steht.

////—1—//// 25:21:1,"**Place the Testimony in the Ark.** I do not know why it is repeated for it has already said: “You shall place in the ark, the Testimony!” It may be said that it comes to teach that when the ark is alone, without the cover, he should beforehand place the Testimony in it and only afterwards place the cover on it. We find [that this actually transpired] when he (Moshe) erected the <font color=d50505>»</font>mishkon<font color=d50505>«</font> it states: “He placed the Testimony in the ark,” and afterward: “He placed the cover on the ark on top.” "

§§—2—§§ 25:21:1," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ואל <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>הארן <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>תתן <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>את <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>העדות AND IN THE ARK THOU SHALT PUT THE TESTIMONY — I do not know why this is repeated for it has already been commanded, (v. 16) “and thou shalt put the Testimony in the ark”. One may say that it intends to tell us that whilst the ark is still by itself — i. e. without the cover — he should first put the Testimony into it, and only afterwards should he put the cover on it for the first time. Thus indeed do we find: that when he (Moses) erected the Tabernacle it is stated, (Exodus 40:20) “and he [took and] put the Testimony into the ark”, and afterwards it says, “and he put the cover upon the ark above it” (cf. Talmud Yerushalmi Shekalim 6:1)."

—3— **21. Und in die Lade lege das Gesetz;** ich weiß nicht, warum es doppelt steht, da schon gesagt worden (V. 16), lege in die Lade das Gesetz; man kann sagen, er will damit lehren, dass man, solange die Lade für sich ist, ohne den Deckel, zuerst das Gesetz hineinlege und dann erst den Deckel darauflege. So finden wir auch; als er die Wohnung aufrichtete, heißt es (40, 20), er legte das Gesetz in die Lade, und dann, er legte den Deckel oben auf die Lade. 

---

////—1—//// 25:22:1,"**I will set My meetings.** When I set a meeting for you to speak with you, it is at that place that I will set the meeting, so that I come there to speak to you. "

§§—2—§§ 25:22:1, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ונועדתי AND [THERE] I WILL BE MET [BY THEE] — When I shall appoint you a place of meeting to speak to you that place will I appoint as the place of meeting whither I will come to speak to you.

—3— **22. Ich werde mich offenbaren;** wenn ich dir eine Zusammenkunft bestimme, um mit dir zu sprechen, so werde ich jenen Ort zur Zusammenkunft bestimmen, dass ich dorthin komme, um mit dir zu sprechen. 

---

////—1—//// 25:22:2,"**And I will speak with you from above the cover.** But elsewhere it says: “God spoke to him from the Tent of Meeting saying,” which refers to the part of the <font color=d50505>»</font>mishkon<font color=d50505>«</font> that is outside of the partition. Consequently there are two verses contradicting each other. The third verse now comes and reconciles them: “When Moshe would come into the Tent of Meeting, etc. he would hear the Voice speaking to him from above the cover, etc.” [We thereby learn that the following actually took place:] Moshe would enter the <font color=d50505>»</font>mishkon<font color=d50505>«</font> and as soon as he would come inside the entranceway the Voice would descend from the heavens to between the cherubim [on top of the cover] and it would emanate from there and be heard by Moshe in the Tent of Meeting. "

§§—2—§§ 25:22:2," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ודברתי <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אתך <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מעל <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>הכפרת AND I SHALL SPEAK WITH THEE FROM ABOVE THE COVER — In another passage, however, it says, (Leviticus 1:1) “And God spake unto him out of the appointed tent, saying” — this is that part of the Tabernacle outside the partition veil whilst the ark and the cover were on the other tide of the veil — consequently we have two verses contradicting each other! But there comes a third verse and reconciles them: (Numbers 7:89) “And when Moses came into the appointed tent to speak with Him, he heard the voice speaking unto him from off the covering etc.” This verse explains exactly what happened. Moses came into the Tabernacle and as soon as he had passed the entrance a voice fell from heaven to the place on the cover which was between the cherubim, and from there it issued and was heard by Moses in the tent of meeting (outside the Holy of Holies; cf. Sifrei Bamidbar 58 and Rashi on Numbers 7:89)."

—3— **Und mit dir vom Deckel herab sprechen,** an anderer Stelle sagt er (Lev. 1, 1), der Ewige sprach zu ihm aus dem Zelte der Offenbarung also, das ist die Wohnung außerhalb des Vorhanges vor dem Allerheiligsten; daraus ergibt sich, dass die beiden Verse einander widersprechen, darum kommt der dritte Vers und entscheidet zwischen ihnen (Num. 7, 89), wenn Mosche ins Zelt der Offenbarung hineinging, dass Er mit ihm spreche, so hörte er die Stimme vom Deckel herab zu sich sprechen; Mosche ging ins Heiligtum, und sobald er in den Eingang eingetreten war, kam die Stimme vom Himmel herab zwischen die beiden Cherubim, und von dort kam sie heraus und wurde von Mosche im Zelte der Offenbarung vernommen (Sifre <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ואת). (<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>נשא alles, was ich dir für die Kinder Israel befehle, dieses Waw ist übrig und angehängt; Ähnliches kommt oft im Vers vor, und du musst es so erklären, und was ich dort mir dir rede, ist all das, was ich dir für die Kinder Israel befehle). 

---

////—1—//// 25:22:3,**All that which I will command you concerning the B’nei Yisrael.** The letter <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ו' here is superfluous and of minor importance. There are many such instances in Scripture. This is how it should be interpreted: “<font color=d50505>»</font>And<font color=d50505>«</font> that which I will speak to you there: all that I will command you will be concerning the B’nei Yisrael.”

§§—2—§§ 25:22:3, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ואת <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>כל <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אשר <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אצוה <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אותך <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אל <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בני <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ישראל AND OF ALL WHICH I SHALL COMMAND THEE CONCERNING THE CHILDREN OF ISRAEL — This <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ו of the word <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ואת is redundant and without import; there are many sentences similar to this in Scripture. However if you wish to explain this <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ו the verse must be interpreted as follows: [I shall speak with thee from above the cover] and that which (<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ואת) I shall speak to you will be everything I shall command thee concerning the children of Israel.


---

////—1—//// 25:23:1,"**Its height.** I.e., the height of its legs together with the thickness of the table. "

§§—2—§§ 25:23:1, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>קמתו THE HEIGHT THEREOF — i. e. the height of its legs together with the thickness of the table-board.

—3— **23. Seine Höhe,** die Höhe seiner Füße mit der Dicke der Tischplatte (Pess. 109b). 

---

////—1—//// 25:24:1,"**A gold crown-like rim.** This is a symbol of the royal crown for “the table” represents wealth and greatness, as people express it: “a royal table.” "

§§—2—§§ 25:24:1," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>זר <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>זהב A BORDER OF GOLD — a symbol of the royal crown, for the table is an emblem of wealth and greatness, as may be seen from the fact that people speak of one’s “royal table” when they wish to state one is exceedingly wealthy (cf. Yoma 72b)."

—3— **24. Eine goldene Krone,** ein Symbol für die Königskrone; denn der Tisch ist ein Sinnbild für Reichtum und Größe, wie man sagt, ein königlicher Tisch (Joma 72b). 

---

////—1—//// 25:25:1,"**A ledge.** As Onkelos translates it <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>גְדַנְפָא — “a protruding ledge.” Regarding this there is a dispute among the Sages of Israel. There are those who say [that the <font color=d50505>»</font>misgeres<font color=d50505>«</font>] was at the top around the <font color=d50505>»</font>shulchan<font color=d50505>«</font> like the vertical rims that [are to be found]A at the edges of tables of the aristocracy (<font color=d50505>»</font>see illustration 2 on page 140<font color=d50505>«</font>). There are others who say that [the <font color=d50505>»</font>misgeres<font color=d50505>«</font>] was fastened at the bottom from one leg [of the <font color=d50505>»</font>shulchan<font color=d50505>«</font>] to another legB on all four sides of the <font color=d50505>»</font>shulchan,<font color=d50505>«</font> and the flat board of the <font color=d50505>»</font>shulchan<font color=d50505>«</font>C rested on that <font color=d50505>»</font>misgeres.<font color=d50505>«</font> "

§§—2—§§ 25:25:1," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מסגרת — Understand this as the Targum renders it: <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>גדנפא, A RIM. The Sages in Israel are of different opinion as to what this <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מסגרת signifies. Some say it was on top all the way round the table like the vertical ledge that is on the edges of the table of noble men, whilst others say it was fixed beneath the table from leg to leg on the four sides of the table and that the table-top rested upon that ledge (cf. Menachot 96b and Sukkah 5a)."

—3— **25. Eine Leiste,** wie der Targum sagt, Leiste, Einfassung; die Weisen Israels sind darüber verschiedener Meinung (Menachot 96b); manche sagen, sie war oberhalb rings um den Tisch, wie die Leisten am Rande des Tisches der Fürsten; und manche sagen, sie war unten von Fuß zu Fuß an den vier Seiten des Tisches befestigt, und die Platte des Tisches lag auf jener Leiste. 

---

////—1—//// 25:25:2,**And make a gold crown-like rim around the ledge.** It is the same crown-like rim mentioned above. Here it clarifies for you that it was put onto the ledge.

§§—2—§§ 25:25:2," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ועשית <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>זר <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>זהב <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>למסגרתו AND THOU SHALT MAKE A GOLDEN BORDER TO THE RIM THEREOF —This is the same border spoken of above (v. 24), and here it explains to you that it was fixed to the rim."

—3— **Und mache eine goldene Krone über seiner Leiste,** das ist die obenerwähnte Krone, und er erklärt dir hier, dass sie sich über der Leiste befand. 

---

////—1—//// 25:27:1,**The rings shall be against the ledge.** They were fastened to the legs opposite the edges of the ledge.D

§§—2—§§ 25:27:1, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לעמת <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>המסגרת <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>תהיין <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>הטבעת OVER AGAINST THE RIM SHALL THE RINGS BE — inserted in the legs over against the extremities of the border.

—3— **27. Der Leiste gegenüber seien die Ringe,** an deren Füßen befestigt, den Enden der Leiste gegenüber. 

---

////—1—//// 25:27:2,"**Receptacles for the poles.** I.e., these rings shall be receptacles into which the poles will be inserted. "

§§—2—§§ 25:27:2, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לבתים <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לבדים FOR PLACES FOR THE STAVES — These rings shall be receptacles in which to put the staves. 

—3— **Als Gehäuse für die Stangen,** jene Ringe seien die Gehäuse, um die Stangen in sie hineinzulegen. <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לבתים als Gehäuse zu dienen. 

---

////—1—//// 25:27:3,**Houses —** <font color=d50505>»</font>for the purpose<font color=d50505>«</font> of being receptacles. **Receptacles.** As Onkelos translates it: “a place for the poles.”

§§—2—§§ 25:27:3,"<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לבתים means for the purpose of being (to serve as) receptacles for the staves, as the Targum has it: places for the staves."

—3— **Für die Stangen,** wie der Targum sagt, als Ort für die Stangen.
