////—1—//// 30:26:1,**Anoint with it.** All anointings were done in the form of the Greek <font color=d50505>»</font>chi<font color=d50505>«</font> except those of kings which are done in the form of a crown.

§§—2—§§ 30:26:1, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ומשחת <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בו AND THOU SHALT ANOINT WITH IT — All anointings mentioned in Scriptures were made in the form of a Greek X except the anointing of kings which were made round the head like a crown (wreath) (Keritot 5b).

—3— **26. Und salbe damit,** alle Salbungen waren wie ein griechisches Chi außer derjenigen der Könige, die wie eine Krone war (Ker. 5b). 

---

////—1—//// 30:29:1,"**Sanctify them.** It is this anointing which sanctifies them to become holy of holies. And what is the manifestation of their holiness? It is: “Anything that touches them, etc.” [This means:] anything that is fit for a sacred vessel, once it comes into it (i.e., the vessel) it becomes intrinsically holy, so that it will become unfit though <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>יוֹצֵא, [i.e., if taken out of the courtyard of the <font color=d50505>»</font>mishkon<font color=d50505>«</font>] or <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לִינָה, [i.e., being left overnight off the altar], or [by coming in contact with] a <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>טְבוּל <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>יוֹם and cannot be redeemed so as to become secular. However, anything that is not fit for them they do not sanctify. This is stated as an undisputed Mishnah (i.e., a <font color=d50505>»</font>beraisa<font color=d50505>«</font>) concerning the altar. From that which is stated: “Whatever touches the altar becomes sanctified,” I might infer that this applies whether it is fit [for the altar] or whether it is not fit. The Torah, therefore, says [in the next verse]: “sheep” — just as sheep are fit [for the altar], so must everything be fit [to be sanctified by the altar]. Every anointing of the <font color=d50505>»</font>mishkon, kohanim<font color=d50505>«</font> and kings is translated by Onkelos as <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>רִבּוּי — “elevating to a higher status” because the only purpose of anointing is to elevate to a higher status, for so did the King (God) establish that this [shall be the method] of installation to a higher status. However, other anointings, for example, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>רְקִיקִין <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מְשׁוּחִים (anointed wafers), or: “With the important oils shall they anoint (<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>יִמְשָׁחוּ),” their Aramaic version is the same as the Hebrew. "

§§—2—§§ 30:29:1," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>וקדשת <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אתם AND THOU SHALT SANCTIFY THEM — This anointing (mentioned v. 26) sanctifies them so that they become most holy. And in what consists their holiness? <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>כל <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>הנגע <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בהם <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>וגו׳ that WHOSOEVER TOUCHETH THEM [SHALL BECOME HOLY]. — Whatever is proper for use in a particular sacred vessel becomes itself holy (more lit., becomes holy with bodily holiness) as soon as it comes into it, so that it becomes invalid as an offering under the following conditions: when after it had been placed in the vessel it had been taken (lit., had gone forth) outside the fore-court, or when it had been left the whole of the night without being placed on the altar, or when it has come into contact with a <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>טבול <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>יום (a person who had been unclean and has taken the ritual immersion but is awaiting sunset to be regarded as clean, as is prescribed in Leviticus 22:7). Moreover it cannot be redeemed by payment of its value to the Temple treasury, thereby to reassume its ordinary character. But whatever is not proper to them (to these vessels) they do not make holy (Zevachim 87a). A similar statement is made in an uncontroverted (Hebrew: perfect) Boraitha (Zevachim 83b) about the hallowing power of the altar: Since it is said, (Exodus 29:37) “Whatsoever toucheth the altar shall become holy”, I might infer that this applies to a thing whether it was fitting to be an offering at the time when it was brought into the Sanctuary or whether it was not fitting; Scripture therefore states immediately afterwards, (Exodus 29:38) “[Now this is that which thou shalt offer upon the altar]; two lambs”. Now how is it in the case of the lambs? They are fitting for the altar! So, also, does the preceding statement, “Whatsoever [touches the altar shall become holy]”, refer only to anything that is fitting (i. e. that was already fitting to be brought upon the altar and became disqualified only after it had been brought into the forecourt of the Sanctuary). — In all cases where the term <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>משח, “to anoint”, is used with reference to the Tabernacle or priests or kings it is rendered by the Targum by the appropriate form of the verb <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>רבה, “to raise to high rank”, “to distinguish”, because the anointing of them had no other purpose than to show the distinction that was being bestowed upon them. For thus did the Heavenly King ordain (Rashi uses here the words of the text, (Esther 1:9) that this should constitute their installation in their high office. In any other case, however, where <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>משח is used, — for instance, (Exodus 29:2) “wafers [unleavened] <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>משוחים with oil”; (Amos 6:6) “and with the chief ointments <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ימשחו” — the Aramaic expression for them in the Targum is the same term as the Hebrew text, viz., a form of <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>משח; (because in these passages anointing is an end in itself, whilst in the former case it is an indication only of elevation to a distinguished position)."

—3— **29. Und heilige sie,** diese Salbung heiligt sie, dass sie allerheiligst werden; und worin besteht ihre Heiligkeit? Alles, was berührt, alles, was für das Dienstgerät geeignet ist, erhält, sobald es hineinkommt, selbst Heiligkeit, dass es durch Verlassen des Vorhofes, durch Übernachten und durch Berührung von einem, der sich heute untergetaucht, aber noch keinen Sonnenuntergang gehabt hat, untauglich wird, dass es ferner nicht ausgelöst werden kann, um zur Unheiligkeit hinauszugehen; aber eine Sache, die nicht für die Dienstgeräte geeignet ist, heiligen sie nicht (Seb. 87a). Bezüglich des Altares wird darüber eine vollkommene Mischna gelernt (Seb. 83b); dadurch, dass steht (29,37), alles, was den Altar berührt, wird heilig, könnte ich meinen, ob es geeignet oder ob es nicht geeignet sei, darum heißt es gleich darauf Lämmer; wie Lämmer geeignet sind, so auch alles, was geeignet ist. Jede <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>משיחה beim Heiligtum, bei den Priestern und den Königen wird vom Targum mit dem Ausdruck <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>רבוי Erhöhung übersetzt, weil ihre Salbung nur nötig war, um sie auszuzeichnen; denn so hat der König bestimmt, dass sie damit in ihr Amt eingeführt werden sollen; aber andere Salbungen wie (29, 2), Fladen, die bestrichen werden; (Amos 6,6) mit dem ersten Öle sich salben, werden im Aramäischen wie im Hebräischen wiedergegeben.

////—1—//// 30:31:1,"**For all your generations.** From this our Sages deduced that one can state that the entire [<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שֶׁמֶן <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>הַמִּשְׁחָה] will be preserved for the time yet to come (i.e., after <font color=d50505>»</font>Moshiach<font color=d50505>«</font> comes). "

§§—2—§§ 30:31:1, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לדרתיכם THROUGHOUT YOUR GENERATIONS — From here our Rabbis derived that it (the oil of anointment) was miraculously preserved in its entirety for the time to come (for the Messianic days) (Horayot 11b).

—3— **31. Für eure Geschlechter;** von hier haben unsere Lehrer entnommen, dass das ganze Öl für die Zukunft erhalten geblieben ist (Krit. 5 b). <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>זה hat im Zahlenwert 12, soviel Log waren es (dort). 

---

////—1—//// 30:31:2,"**This.** The numerical value [of <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>זֶה] [<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ז =7, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ה =5] corresponds to the twelve <font color=d50505>»</font>logs<font color=d50505>«</font> [of the <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שֶׁמֶן <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>הַמִּשְׁחָה]. "

§§—2—§§ 30:31:2," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>זה has the numerical value of 12, alluding to the 12 “logs” which was the measure for the oil of anointment (Horayot 11b; cf. Rashi v. 24)."

////—1—//// 30:32:1,"** <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לֹא <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>יִיסָךְ —** spelled with two letters <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>י' which takes the form: he (or, it) shall not be done, as in: “so that (<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>יִיטַב) it will be well with you.” "

§§—2—§§ 30:32:1," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לא <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ייסך with two “yods” has the meaning “he shall not do something” (i. e. it is 3rd person masc. sing. Kal), similar to <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ייטב in (Deuteronomy 6:18) “that it may be well (<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ייטב) with thee”."

—3— **32. Werde es nicht gesalbt,** mit zwei Jud, passive Bedeutung; wie (Deut. 5,16), damit es dir gut ergehe. 

---

////—1—//// 30:32:2,**It must not be poured on the flesh of any man —** from this oil itself.

§§—2—§§ 30:32:2, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>על <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בשר <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אדם <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לא <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ייסך UPON MAN’S FLESH SHALL IT NOT BE POURED — anything from that selfsame oil (which Moses had prepared).

—3— **Auf das Fleisch eines Menschen werde nicht gesalbt,** von diesem Öle selbst. 

---

////—1—//// 30:32:3,"** <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>וּבְמַתְכֻּנְתּוֹ <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לֹא <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>תַעֲשֹוּ <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>כָּמֹהוּ .** [Meaning:] with the quantity of each of its spices make no other like it, i.e., with the weight of these spices in proportion to the measure of a <font color=d50505>»</font>hin<font color=d50505>«</font> of oil. But if he decreased or increased the spices in proportion to the measure of a <font color=d50505>»</font>hin<font color=d50505>«</font> of oil, then it is permissible. However, even if it were made in the proportions of this one (i.e., the <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שֶׁמֶן <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>הַמִּשְׁחָה), there is no transgression for one who applies it to himself, only for one who blends it [transgresses]. "

§§—2—§§ 30:32:3," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ובמתכנתו <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לא <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>תעשו <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>כמהו AND ACCORDING TO ITS PROPORTION YE SHALL NOT MAKE ANY LIKE IT — In regard to the quantities of its spices ye shall not make any other oil like it — i. e. in regard to the weights of these spices in proportion to the measure of a hin of oil; but if one uses less or more of these spices in proportion to the measure of a hin of oil, it is permitted to do so. And even if it is made in the same proportions as this (the oil made by Moses) it is not the one who anoints himself with it that is punishable (for this applies only to one who anoints himself with the oil made by Moses) but he who compounds it (Keritot 5a). "

—3— **Und mit seinem Verhältnis der Maße mache nicht gleich ihm,** mit der Summe seiner Gewürze machet nicht anderes gleich ihm, mit dem Gewichte dieser Gewürze zu dem Maße eines Hin Öl; wenn er aber zu dem Maße eines Hin Öl weniger oder mehr Gewürze nimmt, ist es erlaubt; und selbst wenn es mit dem Maßverhältnis des heiligen Öles gemacht worden wäre, so ist nicht derjenige schuldig, der sich damit salbt, sondern derjenige, der es hergestellt hat (Krit. 5b).

////—1—//// 30:32:4,"**And its formula.** A term meaning: “a particular quantity,” as in: “(<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מַתְכֹּנֶת) the quantity of bricks.” Similarly: <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בְמַתְכֻּנְתָּה — “in its particular quantity,” of the incense. "

§§—2—§§ 30:32:4,"<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ובמתכנתו is a term denoting amount, as (Exodus 5:8) “the quantity (<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מתכנת) of bricks”. Similar is the word <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מתכנת used of the incense (v. 37)."

—3— **Und mit seinem Maßverhältnis,** bedeutet Zahl, wie (5, 8) Anzahl der Ziegel; ebenso (V. 37), in seinem Maßverhältnis, beim Räucherwerk.

////—1—//// 30:33:1,"**Or if he places from it.** [I.e.,] from the one which Moshe [blended]. "

§§—2—§§ 30:33:1, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ואשר <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>יתן <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ממנו WHOSOEVER PUTTETH ANY OF IT — of that made by Moses (Keritot 5a)

—3— **33. Und wer davon bringt,** von dem Mosches.

////—1—//// 30:33:2,"**Upon an unauthorized person.** [I.e.,] when it is not for the need of the priesthood or kingdom (i.e., anointing a king). "

§§—2—§§ 30:33:2, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>על <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>זר UPON A STRANGER — when it is not required for installing a person into the high-priesthood or kingdom (Keritot 5b).

—3— **Auf einen Fremden,** wenn es nicht für die Priester und Königswürde nötig ist.

////—1—//// 30:34:1,"**stacte.** <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>נָטָף is balsam, but since it is only the sap that drips from the balsam trees it is called <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>נָטָף (from <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>נוֹטֵף — “drips”). In Old French it is called <font color=d50505>»</font>gome<font color=d50505>«</font> (tree sap) and the balsam is called <font color=d50505>»</font>theriake.<font color=d50505>«</font> "

§§—2—§§ 30:34:1," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>נטף is balsam. Because it is merely the sap which drips from the wood of the balsam tree it is called <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>נטף, “dripping” (Keritot 6a). In old French it is called gomme; English gum. The balm itself, however, is called thériaque (cf., however, Ramban)."

—3— **34. Balsam,** das ist Balsam, und weil er nichts anderes als ein Harz ist, das aus den Balsambäumen tropft, wird er <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>נטף (Tropfen) genannt, in anderen Sprachen Baumharz; Balsam nennt man auch Theriak. 

---

////—1—//// 30:34:2,"**Onycha.** It is a smooth fragrant root, translucent like a fingernail. In mishnaic Hebrew it is called <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>צִפּוֹרֶן . And that is the intent of Onkelos when he translates it: <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>וְטוּפְרָא (<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>טוּפְרָא being Aramaic for <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>צִפּוֹרֶן). "

§§—2—§§ 30:34:2," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ושחלת AND ONYCHA This is a root of a fragrant herb, smooth and transparent like a fingernail, In the language of the Mishna it is called <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>צפורן, a nail (cf. Keritot 6a). This is exactly how Onkelos renders it: <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>וטופרא, which is the Aramaic word corresponding to the Hebrew <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>צפורן‎."

—3— **Und Seenagel,** eine Gewürzwurzel, die glatt und leuchtend ist wie ein Fingernagel; in der Sprache der Mischna wird er <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>צפווץ genannt; so übersetzt auch Onkelos mit <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>טופרא. 

---

////—1—//// 30:34:3,"**Galbanum.** A spice with a bad odor, which is called <font color=d50505>»</font>galbanum.<font color=d50505>«</font> Scripture counts it among the spices of the incense to teach us not to look with contempt at including in our gatherings for fasts and prayers the sinners among the Israelites, that they should be counted (i.e., united) with us. "

§§—2—§§ 30:34:3, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>וחלבנה — This is a malodorous spice which is called galbanum. Scripture enumerates it among the spices of the incense to teach us that we should not regard as a light thing the duty of associating with ourselves when we band together for fasts and prayers Israelites who are transgressors — that they should be counted as ourselves (Keritot 6b).

—3— **Und Galban,** ein Gewürz, das einen schlechten Geruch hat; man nennt es Galban, und der Vers zählt es darum unter den Gewürzen des Räucherwerkes auf, um uns zu lehren, dass es in unseren Augen nicht verächtlich sein soll, mit uns in dem Bunde unserer Fasttage und unserer Gebete die Sünder Israels zu vereinigen, dass sie zu uns gezählt werden (Ker. 6b). 

---

////—1—//// 30:34:4,"**Spices.** [I.e.,] other spices. "

§§—2—§§ 30:34:4, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>סמים means other SPICES also.

—3— **Gewürze,** andere Gewürze. 

---

////—1—//// 30:34:5,"**And pure frankincense.** From here our Sages derived that Moshe was told of eleven spices at Sinai: the minimum amount indicated by <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>סַמִּים — “spices,” is two (for the least of any plural is two); stacte, onycha, and galbanum are three; so you have five; <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>סַמִּים [is repeated at this point] so as to add an amount equal to the above; so now you have <font color=d50505>»</font>ten;<font color=d50505>«</font> and frankincense makes it <font color=d50505>»</font>eleven.<font color=d50505>«</font> They are as follows: 1.stacte, 2.onycha, 3.galbanum 4.frankincense, 5.myrrh, 6.cassia, 7.spikenard, 8.saffron; this gives you eight, because <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שִׁבּוֹלֶת and <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>נֵרְד are one, for <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>נֵרְד is similar to <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שִׁבּוֹלֶת; 9.costus, 10.aromatic bark, 11.cinnamon, giving you the total of eleven. <font color=d50505>»</font>Boris karshina<font color=d50505>«</font> is not burnt but it is used to smooth the onycha in order to whiten it so as to make it pleasing to the eye. "

§§—2—§§ 30:34:5," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ולבנה <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>זכה AND PURE FRANKINCENSE — From here our Rabbis learned that eleven spices were mentioned to Moses on Sinai (a technical term, like <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>הלכה <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>למשה <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מסיני) as the ingredients of the incense. For the least number implied by the plural <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>סמים is two; balsam, onycha and galbanum are three, making together five. The word <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>סמים that follows (without stating any number) is intended to add a similar number as these already prescribed, viz., five, making ten, and frankincense makes eleven. They are the following: balm, onycha, galbanum, frankincense, myrrh, cassia, spikenard and saffron, altogether eight — for <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שבלת and <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>נרד are one, it being given this compound name only because the nard resembles a <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שבלת, a spike, — costus, aromatic bark and cinnamon, altogether eleven. “Borith karshina” (lye obtained from a species of vetch) which is also mentioned in Keritotot 6a in connection with the ingredients of the incense was not burnt itself as incense, but the onycha was rubbed with it in order to whiten it — that it should be (look) better (Keritot 6a)."

—3— **Und reinen Weihrauch,** von hier entnehmen unsere Lehrer (Ker. 6b), elf Gewürze wurden Mosche auf dem Sinai gesagt; die kleinste Mehrheit von Gewürzen sind zwei, Balsam. Seenagel und Galban sind noch drei, also fünf. Das zweite Gewürze fügt noch ebensoviel wie diese hinzu, das sind zehn, und Weihrauch, das sind elf; und das sind sie: Balsam, Seenagel, Galban, Weihrauch, Myrrhe, Kezia, Ähre der Narde und Krokus, das sind acht; denn Ähre der Narde ist eins, die Narde gleicht nämlich einer Ähre; Koschet, Kelufa und Kinman, das sind elf. Borit Karschina wird nicht verdampft, sondern man reibt damit den Seenagel ab, um ihn zu bleichen, dass er schön sei. 

---

////—1—//// 30:34:6,"**They shall be of equal weight.** The four explicitly mentioned here shall be equal — weight for weight. The weight of one should be the same weight as the other, and so we learned: the balsam, the onycha, the galbanum, and the frankincense each had a weight of seventy <font color=d50505>»</font>manehs.<font color=d50505>«</font> The word <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בַּד, it seems to me, is a term for “a single one” [<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בַּד <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בְּבַד <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>יִהְיֶה — therefore has the meaning:] “they shall be one for one” [i.e.,] one like the other. "

§§—2—§§ 30:34:6," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בד <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בבד <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>יהיה means, these four ingredients mentioned here shall be equal, weight for weight — as the weight of one so shall be the weight of another. Thus indeed we learn (Keritot 6a): the balm, the onycha, the galbanum and the frankincense shall each have the weight of seventy manehs. The term <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בד seems to me to mean “a single article” (cf. <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בָּדָד, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לְבַד) – they shall be “one equal with one”: they shall be the one the same as the other."

—3— **Aus gleichen Teilen sollen sie bestehen,** diese vier hier erwähnten sollen von gleichem Gewicht sein; soviel, wie das eine wiegt, soll auch das andere wiegen; so haben wir auch gelernt (Krit. 6b), vom Balsam, Seenagel, Galban und Weihrauch je 70 Minen; das Wort <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בד, scheint mir, bedeutet einzeln, ein Teil von jedem, das eine betrage soviel wie das andere. 

---

////—1—//// 30:35:1,"**Thoroughly blended.** As Onkelos translates it: “mixed,” [i.e.] the particles must be mixed thoroughly with one another. It is my opinion that similar to this (i.e., <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מְמֻלָּח) is: “(<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>הַמַּלָחִים) the sailors were frightened” [or:] “(<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מַלָחַיִךְ) your sailors and your pilots.” [They are so called] because they keep turning the water over (mixing) with oars when they move the ship, similar to a person who stirs beaten eggs with a spoon in order to mix them with water. Anything that a person wants to mix thoroughly he turns over (stirs up) with a finger or a spoon. "

§§—2—§§ 30:35:1," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ממלח TEMPERED TOGETHER — Understand this as the Targum renders it: <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מעורב, mixed — that they should thoroughly intermix the powder of the ingredients. I think that similar in meaning to it are the nouns in (Jona 1:5) “Then the mariners (<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>המלחים) were afraid”; (Ezekiel 27:27) “thy mariners (<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מלחיך) and thy pilots”, who are so called because they turn over (stir up) the water with oars when they propel the ship — like a person who stirs up beaten eggs with a spoon in order to mix them with water. Anything that a person wishes to mix up thoroughly he stirs up with his finger or with a spoon."

—3— **35. Vermengt,** wie der Targum sagt, vermischt; er mische das Gestoßene sehr gut, eins mit dem anderen; ich meine, dass damit zu vergleichen (Jona 1, 5), die Schiffsleute fürchteten sich; (Jech. 27, 27) deine Ruderer und deine Steuerleute, weil sie das Wasser mit den Rudern durchrühren, wenn sie das Schiff fortbewegen, wie wenn einer zerschlagene Eier mit dem Löffel verrührt, um sie mit dem Wasser zu vermischen; und jede Sache, die jemand gut vermischen will, verrührt er mit dem Finger oder mit dem Löffel. 

---

////—1—//// 30:35:2,"**Thoroughly blended, pure and holy.** Thoroughly blended shall it be, pure shall it be, and holy shall it be. "

§§—2—§§ 30:35:2," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ממלח <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>טהור <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>קדש TEMPERED TOGETHER, PURE AND HOLY — i. e. tempered together shall it (the compound) be, pure shall it be, and holy shall it be."

—3— **Vermengt, rein, eilig;** es sei vermengt und sei rein und sei ein Heiligtum.

////—1—//// 30:36:1,"**And place it, etc.** This refers to the daily incense burning which [was done] on the inner altar which is inside the Tent of Meeting. "

////—1—//// 30:36:2,**Where I will meet with you.** “All appointments that I will set up to speak with you I shall set up in that place.”

§§—2—§§ 30:36:2, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אשר <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אועד <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לך <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שמה WHERE I WILL BE MET BY THEE — All appointments for the purpose of speaking unto you which I shall make with you I shall confine to that place (cf. 
§§—2—§§ 25:22).

////—1—//// 30:37:1,**Its formula.** [Meaning:] according to the quantity of its spices.

§§—2—§§ 30:37:1," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>במתכנתה means, according to the quantity of spices used by Moses."

—3— **37. In seinem Maßverhältnis,** mit der Zahl seiner Gewürze.

////—1—//// 30:37:2,**It shall be sacred to you for Adonoy.** [Meaning:] that you shall do it only for My Name.

§§—2—§§ 30:37:2, ‘<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>קדש <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>תהיה <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לך <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לה IT SHALL BE UNTO THEE HOLINESS FOR THE LORD — This means that you must not make it except in honour of My Name.

—3— **Ein Heiligtum sei es dir für den Ewigen,** bereite es nur meinem Namen zu Ehren.

§§—2—§§ 30:38:1, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>להריח <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בה [WHOSOEVER SHALL MAKE LIKE UNTO THAT] TO SMELL THERETO [SHALL BE CUT OFF] — but you may make some according to these quantities of your own spices for the purpose of selling it to the community (cf. Keritot 5a).

—3— **38. Um daran zu riechen,** aber du darfst in seinem Maßverhältnis von dem deinigen herstellen, um es der Gemeinde zu verkaufen (Ker. 5a).

////—1—//// 31:2:1,**I have called by name —** to do My work — Betzalel.

§§—2—§§ 31:2:1, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>קראתי <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בשם I HAVE CALLED BY NAME — to accomplish My work — BEZALEL.

////—1—//// 31:3:1,"**With wisdom.** [“Wisdom” refers to] that which a person hears from others, and learns. "

§§—2—§§ 31:3:1, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>חכמה WISDOM is what a person hears from others and learns (makes his own).

—3— **3. Weisheit,** was einer von anderen empfangen und gelernt hat.

////—1—//// 31:3:2,**With understanding.** [<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>תְּבוּנָה is what] he understands on his own from things that he has learned [from others].

§§—2—§§ 31:3:2, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>תבונה UNDERSTANDING is understanding a matter by one’s own intelligence deducing it from the things one has already learned.

—3— **Einsicht,** der eine Sache durch seinen eigenen Verstand infolge der Dinge, die er gelernt hat, versteht.

////—1—//// 31:3:3,**With knowledge.** [<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>דַּעַת refers to] Divine Inspiration.

§§—2—§§ 31:3:3, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>דעת means holy inspiration.

—3— **Erkenntnis** ist prophetischer Geist.

////—1—//// 31:4:1,**To devise plans —** [refers to] the weaving of a master craftsman.

§§—2—§§ 31:4:1," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לחשב <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מחשבה lit., TO DEVISE DEVICES — this refers to the weaving of an artist’s work."

—3— **4. Kunstgewebe herzustellen,** das Weben der Weberarbeit. 

---

////—1—//// 31:5:1,"** <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>וּבַחֲרשֶׁת .** Meaning: a craft as in: <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>חָרָשׁ <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>חָכָם — “a wise craftsman.” However, Onkelos explains it more specifically and varies their explanation [in each instance], for a stone craftsman is called <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אוּמָן and a wood craftsman is called <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>נַגָּר . "

§§—2—§§ 31:5:1," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ובחרשת denotes artisanship generally, as (Isaiah 40:20) “a clever artisan (<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>חרש <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>חכם)”. Onkelos, however, more closely defines the term each time it occurs in this verse and varies the definition he gives of them: the first he renders by <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אמנות and the second by <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>נגרות, because the lapidary is called in Aramaic <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אמן, whilst the worker in wood is called <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>נגר, and he therefore uses the abstract forms of these nouns to specify the particular kind of artisanship here intended."

—3— **5. Und mit der Bearbeitung,** bedeutet Kunstarbeit wie (Jes. 40, 20), einen weisen Künstler; Onkelos übersetzt mit verschiedenen Ausdrücken, der Steinkünstler wird von ihm <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אומן und der Holzkünstler <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>נגר genannt. 

---

////—1—//// 31:5:2,**For setting (lit. to fill).** [I.e] to place it into its setting in its entirety [i.e.] to make the setting [corresponding] to the measurement of the bottom of the stone and its thickness.

§§—2—§§ 31:5:2," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>למלאת TO SET IN — i. e. to put it into its setting, so as to fill it in (<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>למלאת) by making the setting according to the size of the bottom of the stones and its thickness."

—3— **Zum Ausfüllen,** in seine Fassung zu legen und damit auszufüllen; die Fassung nach dem Maße der Grundfläche des Steines und seiner Dicke zu machen.

////—1—//// 31:6:1,"**In the heart of every wise-hearted person, etc.** [Meaning:] and the other wise-hearted among you, <font color=d50505>»</font>and<font color=d50505>«</font> anyone to whom I have given wisdom, all these shall do all that I have commanded you. "

§§—2—§§ 31:6:1, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ובלב <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>כל <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>חכם <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לב <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>וגו׳ AND IN THE HEARTS OF ALL THAT ARE WISE HEARTED [I HAVE GIVEN WISDOM] — and there are still other wise-hearted men among you (beside Bezalel and Oholiab) and all these in whom I have given wisdom shall make all that I have commanded thee.

—3— **6. Und ins Herz aller, die weisen Herzens,** und noch mehr Männer weisen Herzens gibt es unter euch; alle, in die ich Weisheit gelegt habe, sollen als das hersteilen, was ich befohlen habe.

////—1—//// 31:7:1,**The ark for the Testimony.** [I.e.] for the purpose of the Tablets of Testimony.

§§—2—§§ 31:7:1," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ואת <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>הארן <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לעדת AND THE ARK FOR THE TESTIMONY — for the purpose of the Tablets of the testimony (not, “the ark to serve as the testimony”; the <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ל denotes “for” in the sense of “for the use of”, and the term <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>עדת is an abbreviation of  <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לחות <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>העדות)."

—3— **7. Und die Lade für das Gesetz,** für die Tafeln des Gesetzes.

////—1—//// 31:8:1,**The pure [Menorah].** So called on account of [its] pure gold.

§§—2—§§ 31:8:1," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>הטהרה THE (PURE [CANDELABRUM] — It is called <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>טהרה because the term <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>זהב <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>טהר, pure gold, is used of it (cf. Exodus 25:31) (not <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>טהרה in contrast to <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>טמאה)."

////—1—//// 31:10:1,"**Garments of crochet-work.** It is my opinion [that] according to the plain meaning of the verse it is impossible to say that it speaks here of the priestly garments for [immediately thereafter] it states: “and the sacred garments of Aharon the <font color=d50505>»</font>kohein<font color=d50505>«</font> and the garments of his sons to serve.” But, [you must say] that these <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בִּגְדֵי <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>הַשְּׂרָד are the “garments” [made of] the greenish-blue wool, and the dark red wool, and the crimson wool which are mentioned in the section of the travels: “They shall spread over it a ‘garment’ of greenish-blue wool” “and spread over it a ‘garment’ of dark red wool,” “they shall place over them a garment of crimson.” It seems that my opinion is correct, for it is said: “And from the greenish-blue wool, the dark red wool, and the crimson wool they made <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בִּגְדֵי <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שְׂרָד to serve in the Sanctuary,” and <font color=d50505>»</font>linen<font color=d50505>«</font> is not mentioned among them. Now, if [it were speaking] of the priestly garments — we do not find in a single one of them [mention of] dark red wool or crimson wool without linen [as well]. "

§§—2—§§ 31:10:1,"‎<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ואת <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בגדי <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>השרד AND THE GARMENTS OF THE SERVICE — I think — according to the plain sense of the verse — that one cannot say that Scripture is here speaking of (referring to) the priestly garments, because to them refer the next words: “and the garments of holiness for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons to minister as priests”. But these <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בגדי <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שרד are identical with the garments of blue purple wool, and red purple wool, and crimson wool which are mentioned in the chapter (Numbers IV.) giving an account of Israel’s encampments: (Numbers 4:12) “and they shall put them in a garment of blue purple”; (Numbers 4:13) “and spread a garment of red purple thereon”; (Numbers 4:8) “and they shall spread upon them a garment of crimson”. And indeed my opinion appears correct, because it is said, (Exodus 39:1) “And of the blue purple, and of the red purple, and of the crimson, they made garments of the service (<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בגדי <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שרד) to minister in the holiness”, and linen is not mentioned among them (these materials). Now if Scripture were speaking of the priestly garments it could not have omitted “linen”“, for we do not find in respect of even one of them (of the priestly garments) mention of red purple or crimson without linen."

—3— **10. Und die Gewänder, des Dienstes,** ich meine, nach dem einfachen Sinne des Verses kann man nicht sagen, dass von den Priestergewändern die Rede sei, weil sich auf diese die folgenden Worte beziehen, und die heiligen Kleider für Aharon, den Priester, und die Kleider seiner Söhne, Priester zu sein; sondern diese Gewänder des Dienstes waren die Gewänder aus himmelblauer, purpurroter und karmesinroter Wolle, die in dem Abschnitt des Aufbruches (Num. 4) erwähnt sind, (V. 12) und sollen sie in ein Gewand von himmelblauer Wolle legen, (V. 13) und darüber ein Gewand von purpurroter Wolle ausbreiten, (V. 8) und sollen darüber ein Gewand von karmesinroter Wolle ausbreiten; und meine Worte leuchten darum ein, weil es (39, 1) heißt, und aus der himmelblauen und der purpurroten und karmesinroten Wolle machten sie Dienstgewänder, im Heiligtum zu dienen; Byssus ist aber nicht dabei erwähnt; wenn er aber von den Priesterkleidern sprechen würde, so finden wir bei keinem einzigen von ihnen purpurrote oder karmesinrote Wolle ohne Byssus. 

---

////—1—//// 31:10:2,"**Garments of crochet-work.** Some explain it as garments of work and service as Onkelos translates it: “garments of service.” Nothing like <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שְׂרָד appears in Scripture. It is my opinion that it is from Aramaic similar to the Targum of the word <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>קְלָעִים and the Targum of <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מִכְבָּר, both of which were woven by needle (crocheted) forming intermittent holes <font color=d50505>»</font>lacediz<font color=d50505>«</font> (net-work) in Old French. "

§§—2—§§ 31:10:2," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בגדי <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>השרד GARMENTS OF SERVICE — Some explain <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שרד to mean work and service (cf. <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שרת to serve), as the Targum renders it: <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לבושי <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שמושא, “garments for the service”. There is, however, no other example of it (of <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שרד) in Scriptures. I, however, think that it is an Aramaic expression, like the Targum of <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>קלעים, hangings, which Onkelos renders by <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שרדין, and of <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מכבר, “grate”, which he renders by <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שרדא, both words denoting net-work, and they are called “garments of <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שרד, net-work”, because they were woven not in the ordinary way but with the needle (a kind of crochet-work), made with many holes; “lacies” in old French; English, net or mesh-work."

—3— **Gewänder des Dienstes,** manche erklären <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שרד als Dienst und Amt, wie der Targum sagt, Gewänder des Dienstes, und das Wort kommt nicht wieder im Vers vor; ich meine, es ist ein Wort, das im Aramäischen vorkommt, gleich dem Targum von Vorhängen (27, 9) und dem Targum von Gitter (27, 4); sie waren nämlich mit der Nadel gewebt (gehäkelt) und bestanden aus lauter Maschen, Schlingwerk in anderen Sprachen.

////—1—//// 31:11:1,**And the incense of spices for the Holy.** For the purpose of bringing up smoke in the <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>הֵיכָל which is [the] <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>קֹדֶשׁ [referred to here].

§§—2—§§ 31:11:1, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ואת <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>קטרת <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>הסמים <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לקדש AND INCENSE OF AROMATICS FOR THE SANCTUARY — i. e. for the purpose of letting it (the incense) rise in smoke in the <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>היכל which is the “<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>קדש” (that part of the Tabernacle or Temple in front of the <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>קדש <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>קדשים‎.

—3— **11. Und das Räucherwerk aus Gewürzarten für das Heiligtum,** für das Räucherwerk des Heiligtums, welches <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>קודש heißt.

////—1—//// 31:13:1,"**And you, speak to the B’nei Yisrael.** “And you, though I have charged you to command them concerning the work of the <font color=d50505>»</font>mishkon,<font color=d50505>«</font> let it not be an easy matter for you to set the Shabbos aside on account of that work.” "

§§—2—§§ 31:13:1," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ואתה <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>דבר <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אל <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>בני <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ישראל SPEAK THOU ALSO UNTO THE CHILDREN OF ISRAEL — AND thou, although I have given thee charge to command them concerning the work of the Tabernacle let it not appear a light thing to thee to set the Sabbath aside on account of that work."

—3— **13. Und du sprich zu den Kindern Israel,** und dir, obschon ich dir aufgetragen habe, ihnen die Herstellung der Wohnung zu befehlen, soll es doch in deinen Augen nicht leicht sein, mit jener Arbeit den Sabbat zu verdrängen. 

---

////—1—//// 31:13:2,"**You must still preserve My Shabbos.** Though you may be preoccupied in the rush of the work [of the <font color=d50505>»</font>mishkon<font color=d50505>«</font>], nevertheless Shabbos should not be set aside on account of it. [This is indicated by the fact that] every time the <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אַךְ or <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>רַק appear [they convey the idea of] limiting or excluding. [Here <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אַךְ appears so as] to exclude Shabbos from any work of the <font color=d50505>»</font>mishkon.<font color=d50505>«</font> "

§§—2—§§ 31:13:2, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אך <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>את <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>שבתתי <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>תשמרו BUT NEVERTHELESS MY SABBATHS SHALL YE KEEP — Even though you be anxious and alert to do the work promptly the Sabbath nevertheless you must not set aside on its account. The words <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אך and <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>רק wherever they occur in Scripture have limitative force (Rosh Hashanah 17b; cf. Rashi on Rosh Hashanah 17b on <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אכין <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ורקין). Here Scripture intends by the word <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אך to except the Sabbath from the days on which the work of the Tabernacle may be done.

—3— **Jedoch sollt ihr meine Sabbate hüten,** obschon ihr eilfertig und hurtig, voll Eifer am Werk seid, darf dennoch der Sabbat nicht dadurch verdrängt werden; alle <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אך und <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>רק sind Einschränkungen (Rosch. h. 17b); den Sabbat von der Arbeit des Heiligtums auszuschließen.

////—1—//// 31:13:3,"**For it is a sign between Me and yourselves.** It is a sign of the esteem between us that I have chosen you, [as is indicated] by My giving to you as a legacy My day of rest, for rest. "

§§—2—§§ 31:13:3," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>כי <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אות <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>היא <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ביני <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>וביניכם FOR IT IS A SIGN BETWEEN ME AND YOU — There is a mark of distinction in the relation that exists between us, viz., the fact that I have chosen you by letting you inherit for rest that day on which “I” rested."

—3— **Denn er ist ein Zeichen zwischen mir und euch,** er ist ein großes Zeichen zwischen uns, dass ich euch erwählt habe, indem ich euch den Tag meiner Ruhe verliehen habe.

////—1—//// 31:13:4,"**To know.** [So that] the nations [know] through it “that I, God, make you holy.” "

§§—2—§§ 31:13:4,"<font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>לדעת TO KNOW — (not, “for you to know”, but) for the nations of the world to know through it, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>כי <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>אני <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ה' <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מקדשכם THAT I AM THE LORD THAT DOTH SANCTIFY YOU."

—3— **Dass man erkenne,** die Völker dadurch erkennen, **dass ich der Ewige euch heilige.**

////—1—//// 31:14:1,**Shall be put to death —** provided there are witnesses and a warning.

§§—2—§§ 31:14:1, <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מות <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>יומת SHALL SURELY BE PUT TO DEATH by the judges if there are witnesses testifying to the desecration and if the warning required by law had been given to the culprit immediately before he committed the offence.

—3— **14. Wer ihn entweiht,** wer seine Heiligkeit unheilig behandelt.

////—1—//// 31:14:2,**Shall be cut off [shall suffer the punishment of <font color=d50505>»</font>kares<font color=d50505>«</font>] —** if there was no warning.

§§—2—§§ 31:14:2," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>ונכרתה SHALL BE CUT OFF [FROM AMONG HIS PEOPLE] by God, if no such warning had been given (Mekhilta d'Rabbi Yishmael 31:14:3)."

—3— **Soll getötet werden,** wenn Zeugen und Warnung da sind. 

---

////—1—//// 31:14:3,"**Anyone who profanes it.** [I.e.,] one who treats it in a profane matter despite its holiness. "

§§—2—§§ 31:14:3," <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>מחלליה means, whosoever treats it as <font color=#d633ff>🟌</font>חול, ordinary, in so far as its sanctity is concerned."

—3— **Werde ausgerottet,** wenn keine Warnung stattfand (Mech.).
